Ethics is not limited to specific acts and defined moral codes, but encompasses the whole of moral ideals and behaviors, a person's philosophy of life (or ''[[Weltanschauung]]'').<ref>Sahakian, William S. & Sahakian, Mabel Lewis. Ethics is not limited to specific acts and defined moral codes, but encompasses the whole of moral ideals and behaviors, a person's philosophy of life (or ''[[Weltanschauung]]'').<ref>Sahakian, William S. & Sahakian, Mabel Lewis. ''Ideas of the Great Philosophers''. pp 31-32. Barnes and Noble Books (1993). ISBN 9781566192712.</ref>

'''Bold text'''Hoppy's Commentary For Thursday Talkline Host Hoppy Kercheva'''Bold text'''
−
Talkline Host Hoppy Kercheva
       
WVU President Mike Garrison may well survive the Bresch scandal. The calendar is working in his favor. He has to get through Wednesday's assembly in which the entire faculty is invited to weigh in on the Bresch mess. Based on Monday's Faculty Senate vote (77 for resignation, 19 against, one abstention), one would expect most of the professors at the assembly will want Garrison gone.
 
WVU President Mike Garrison may well survive the Bresch scandal. The calendar is working in his favor. He has to get through Wednesday's assembly in which the entire faculty is invited to weigh in on the Bresch mess. Based on Monday's Faculty Senate vote (77 for resignation, 19 against, one abstention), one would expect most of the professors at the assembly will want Garrison gone.
